full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement
## Title: Marine Waterlot Assessments

* Title (English/Français): Marine Waterlot Assessments / Évaluations des plans d'eau marine
* Solicitation Number (English/Français): 30006103 / 30006103
* Supplier's Reference Number: cb-721-20790348
* Publication Date: 2024-11-21
* Tender Closing Date: 2024-12-16T14:00:00
* Expected Contract Start Date: 2025-01-13
* Expected Contract End Date: 2025-03-31
* Tender Status: Open
* Notice Type: Request for Proposal

## Contract Opportunity
### Description:
This contract is for Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO) Canada. This requirement includes conducting a Tier I Marine Waterlot Assessment (MWA) at various Small Craft Harbour locations in Newfoundland, along with collecting and holding samples for potential Tier II assessment.

## Mandatory Requirements
Proposals will be evaluated according to the Mandate Criteria outlined below. Bidders must demonstrate that they meet all Mandatory Requirements.

1. Each bidder must propose one (1) Contaminated Sites Approved Professional.
2. Each bidder must have a minimum of 5 years of experience in conducting and completing environmental assessments on waterlots within the last 8 years from the date of bid closing.
3. Each bidder must have a minimum of 5 years of experience in conducting and completing human health and ecological risk assessments for waterlots within the last 10 years from the date of bid closing.
4. Each bidder must have experience working on the Federal Contaminated Sites Action Plan (FCSAP).
5. Each bidder must provide a staffing plan to identify resources assigned to this project.

## Evaluation Method
The evaluation method is based on the highest combined rating of technical merit and price. The requirements are outlined on the attached documents, available at the provided link.

## Attachments
The following documents are available for download:
* 52444/30006103---rfp.pdf
* appendix-b-to-annex-a---working-harbour-guidance-document , version-1.1 (ece-2021.pdf)

## Contact Information
Name and Contact Information:
* Stephanie Patry
* stephanie.patry@dfo-mpo.gc.ca
* (613) 000-0000

Attachments are also provided in the original document. Be sure to properly view them. Please don't
